instruction: In this study, what kinds of spectrum were used to accurately discriminate between citrus canker, Huanglongbing (HLB), citrus scab, and zinc deficiency in citrus orchards?
Output: Fluorescence imaging spectroscopy was used to accurately discriminate between citrus canker, Huanglongbing (HLB), citrus scab, and zinc deficiency in citrus orchards.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to accurately discriminate between citrus canker, Huanglongbing (HLB), citrus scab, and zinc deficiency in citrus orchards?
Output: Fluorescence imaging spectroscopy (FIS) and support vector machine (SVM) technique were used to accurately discriminate between citrus canker, Huanglongbing (HLB), citrus scab, and zinc deficiency in citrus orchards.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification results and how far can this metric go in accurately discriminating between citrus canker, Huanglongbing (HLB), citrus scab, and zinc deficiency?
Output: The chosen metric is accurately discriminate between these citrus diseases. The classification results are highly accurate when discriminating between citrus canker and citrus scab (97.8%) and between HLB and zinc deficiency (95%).

instruction: How did the researchers train the machine learning algorithm to differentiate between citrus diseases using fluorescence imaging spectroscopy (FIS)?
Output: The text does not provide information on how the researchers trained the machine learning algorithm to differentiate between citrus diseases using fluorescence imaging spectroscopy (FIS).

instruction: How accurate were the classification results obtained using the combination of fluorescence imaging spectroscopy (FIS) and machine learning in discriminating between citrus canker, citrus scab, HLB, and zinc deficiency?
Output: The classification results obtained using the combination of fluorescence imaging spectroscopy (FIS) and machine learning were highly accurate. The accuracy in discriminating between citrus canker and citrus scab was 97.8%, while the accuracy in discriminating between HLB and zinc deficiency was 95%. These results demonstrate the effectiveness of the FIS and machine learning approach in accurately identifying citrus diseases with similar symptoms.
